Q0.reasoning: Patient info states the cardiologist ordered whole genome sequencing (WGS) for the fetus at 33 weeks gestation.

Q1.reasoning: Policy explicitly addresses prenatal/fetal sequencing (fetus with ultrasound anomalies) as an allowed scenario for genome/exome testing; the patient is a fetus (33 wks), so the age/gestational status falls within the policy prenatal criteria that permit sequencing when other criteria are met.

Q2.reasoning: Policy requires pre-test counseling/evaluation by an ABMGG board-certified medical geneticist or an ABGC board-certified genetic counselor for fetal sequencing; the patient record states there is no documentation of pre-test genetic counseling, so ordering-provider requirements are not satisfied per policy.

Q3.reasoning: Policy's fetal indication requires all criteria (including pre-test counseling and prior CMA/karyotype non-diagnostic). Although the fetus has an ultrasound anomaly (severe CHD), required fetal- sequencing criteria are not fully met in the record (missing counseling and no documentation that CMA/karyotype were non-diagnostic).

Q4.reasoning: Policy for fetal sequencing requires standard chromosomal microarray (CMA) and karyotype analysis to have failed to yield a definitive diagnosis prior to WES (and WGS is allowed only after WES failure). The patient record does not document prior CMA/karyotype or prior WES, so required prior testing has not been completed.

Q5.reasoning: The policy includes specific family-history scenarios as potential indications (e.g., prior undiagnosed affected fetus/recurrence). The documented family history (maternal aunt with triple-negative breast cancer) is not the type of family/recurrence history cited by the policy and therefore does not meet the policy's family-history eligibility criteria.

Q6.reasoning: Policy explicitly requires pre-test counseling by an ABMGG medical geneticist or ABGC genetic counselor for fetal sequencing; the chart states there is no documentation of pre-test genetic counseling, so counseling requirements are not met.

Q7.reasoning: The provided policy text does not specify or map particular CPT codes to WGS/WES testing; no CPT guidance is present in the document excerpt.

Q8.reasoning: Under the policy WGS is covered only when WES has been unable to identify a causative mutation and all fetal-sequencing criteria are met (including documented pre-test genetic counseling and prior CMA/karyotype non-diagnostic). The record lacks documentation of required pre-test counseling, prior CMA/karyotype results, and prior WES, so coverage criteria for WGS are not met.
